intro: Mormodes oestlundiana, commonly known as the Oestlund's mormodes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species among horticulturists and plant enthusiasts.
